snippet: The matchups are averaging 16.2 million viewers, up 71 percent from the 9.5 million last season’s games drew to the NFL Network over a comparable four weeks.
abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column observes that after making deal for eight games from NFL Network's Thursday night package, NFL upgraded what had been a less-than-stellar schedule, beefing up on division rivalries; notes that games are averaging 16.2 million viewers, up 71 percent from the 9.5 million last season’s games drew to the NFL Network over a comparable four weeks.
lead_paragraph: The matchups are averaging 16.2 million viewers, up 71 percent from the 9.5 million last season’s games drew to the NFL Network over a comparable four weeks.

headline.main: CBS Building Thursday Night Outpost for N.F.L. Games
headline.print_headline: CBS Is Building an N.F.L. Outpost on Thursdays
